website_summaries.verdict: An affordable and fun way to introduce preschoolers to STEM concepts; older kids may need more of a challenge, so consider others we reviewed for them.
pros: Gets youngsters' imaginations going thanks to its moving parts and bright colors
As they "drill" the robot's numerous parts, they will learn and have fun at the same time
cons: Fairly basic, and may be somewhat boring for kids over 5 or 6 years old

customer_reviews.title: My son loved it!
customer_reviews.text: When i fist ordered it i was skeptical because most robot toys are very sharp and heavy. When it arrived i was surprised at the quality of the product but what i most loved about this toy was when my 2 year old son saw it his face lit up with happiness and rushed us to open it for him. He is speech delayed but clearly said "robot" multiple times. He even went to sleep with it in his arms.
customer_reviews.author: Nora

customer_reviews.title: Remedial toy with sticker issues.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with stickers missing for some pieces, stickers that fit awkwardly onto their intended pieces. Also, it says not for ages 0-3, but my kid would've enjoyed this from 2-3. As a 5 year old, this toy is way too simple. It's only bolts that screw into a robot. It's not creative and you can't take the robot apart beyond the lower arm pieces. Not exciting for STEM.
customer_reviews.author: JMEllis

customer_reviews.title: Fun briefly for preschooler
customer_reviews.text: My 9 year old son was having a robot themed birthday party where all the kids were going to assemble a simple robotic kit for the activity. I got this item to give my 3 year old daughter something to keep occupied while the other older ones were doing their activity. It served the purpose fine but once it’s assembled there’s not much interest, the child can put in the screws with the tool and take out again but loses interest after completing it.
customer_reviews.author: brollyhock

customer_reviews.title: My son loves it so much!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my 4-years old baby, when he knew it, he’s been expected for whole day😂 Usually my son went to bed on 9~9:30,last night,he didn’t want to go bed until 10:30,just because he’s really like the robot.He put the screws on and take it out,on and out all the time😂Even when he went to sleep, he want the robot stay beside him
customer_reviews.author: Pan Zhou

customer_reviews.title: Great product, but didn't have the effect I was hoping for.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grandson who loves robots. When he first saw it his enthusiasm was great and he seemed to really like it. However, and this is not a bad statement about the toy, maybe more of statement about how things have come to be, when he realized it didn't light up or make noise he lost interest in it. I still think it is a great learning toy but I am from another time when we loved turning screws and using tools. I am not sorry I bought it and I will keep working to get him interested in it.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy O

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The robot itself is just ok. Very simple, only the arms and screws come out. I expected that though, so that's not where my issue is. The stickers however are horrible. They are oversized for the features they go on so the edges of the stickers hang off and will undoubtedly rip or fall off right away. Also, the stickers shown on the box are not the stickers included in the package, so it was sort of a "choose your own adventure" when applying them.
customer_reviews.author: CHerm

customer_reviews.title: Fun toy for young children
customer_reviews.text: Great toy for children who love taking things apart. Bought this for my 3 year old and he loves it. The screws do not stay on too tight when put on and can come loose by just playing with the toy, but I imagine that if they were to go on any tighter then it would be too difficult for young children to put it together and take it apart. Simple toy, but fun.
customer_reviews.author: J. D. Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Only arms can be dissembled
customer_reviews.text: My 3YO was bored within 2 mins as he said "you can only put the decorated screws in". Nothing can be assembled/disassembled except the arms. All the extra screws can only be attached to the surface. Sure, you can put the stickers on to wherever you want on this robot. For those 5-star reviews, I honestly have no idea how this toy can keep your children entertained.
customer_reviews.author: SpicyIceland

customer_reviews.title: My 3 year old loves it!
customer_reviews.text: As some of the reviews said, some of the stickers don't fit... The one that is supposed to go on the legs. But it's not really a big deal. He was so excited that #1 it's a robot, #2 there are screws, #3 the arms detach, & #4 the parts move. He's into it. I bought it to keep him busy at the airport/plane. I'll pack it in his little backpack. Two thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: Olivia E.

customer_reviews.title: VERY COOL ROBOT
customer_reviews.text: I love how it came packed the nuts& bolts were visible as well as the stickers, and I was able to place everything in the package to give as a gift. Toy seems very durable for toddler handling. I bought it for my 18 month old who is interested in taking things apart and putting back together. It is recommended for ages 3+ but I supervise my 18m old and help him as necessary. I plan to purchase a few more just so he can have several robots. He loves them. Well worth the price.perfect toy.
customer_reviews.author: Teetee_007

customer_reviews.title: I should have read the reviews..
customer_reviews.text: I should have read the reviews. I typically do, but this toy seemed pretty straightforward to me. I erroneously assumed that the robot would be able to be taken apart and put back together. As other reviewers mentioned, this is not the case. My 3 year old loves taking things apart and putting them back together. He is way too advance for this toy. If you would prefer that your child not take apart the toy, this robot is well constructed and cute. It's just not what I expected, and will likely be short-lived in our house.
customer_reviews.author: BusyMom

customer_reviews.title: 4 Year Old Loves It
customer_reviews.text: I was kind of disappointed when I opened this. I guess I expected more out of it, like it teaching shapes or connecting the arms and legs and stuff. But it's really just a hunk of plastic that your kid can screw these little provided screws into. But my 4 year old son got it as a gift for his birthday and absolutely LOVED it. And then he showed me how the provided screwdriver doubles as a "special bologna cutter". So, Win?
customer_reviews.author: Nizza

customer_reviews.title: Three year old lost interest in one day
customer_reviews.text: My three year old son lost interest in it the next day. Not much to play with as there are a few screws to unscrew or tighten. Material quality seems good though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Encourages dexterity and analytical thinking for little ones
customer_reviews.text: If you have a curious child who enjoys tinkering this is the perfect toy! This robot was a big hit with my 2.5 year old. He is able to easily use the toy screw driver to detach and reattach the robots arms. There are a few different screws to you can practice colors with and it’s a great way to encourage analytical thinking and dexterity for little brains out there. Overall it’s cute, sturdy and well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: Great for boys and girls
customer_reviews.text: My sons and my daughter enjoyed playing with this toy. It they figured it out on their own and played for at least an hour.
customer_reviews.author: Phoebe Farag Mikhail

customer_reviews.title: Get Ready for Fun!
customer_reviews.text: The Design & Drill Robot allows you to design a robot using the stickers that come in the box and then you can use the drill to screw in the pieces to build your own robot! #STEM My daughter (age 6) loves this! It is also great for fine motor development!
customer_reviews.author: J. Weaver

customer_reviews.title: Bolts break
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for use in a K-2 Tech room. All grade levels loved it. However, children can produce enough torque to snap the bolts. You can hear their little hearts break when this happens too. But, if only one or two small children were playing with this toy, I think it would survive nicely. Perhaps replacement bolts could be offered? I would give it 5 stars for extra bolts.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: The perfect gift
customer_reviews.text: I worried about the quality since this gift was so inexpensive, but I was pleasantly surprised. It's the perfect size, sturdily built, vivid colors, moveable parts, large pieces which are easy to maneuver, and not prone to breaking. My son LOVES this gifts and spent hours playing with it. It's one of his new favorites.
customer_reviews.author: Susan A.

customer_reviews.title: Still a favorite!
customer_reviews.text: When I bought this for my 3 year old for Christmas I did not think it would be his favorite toy.. he’s played with this consistently since Christmas (so over 6 months). He LOVES it!
customer_reviews.author: Caroline S

customer_reviews.title: This robot is super cute, and maybe I read the description wrong
customer_reviews.text: This robot is super cute, and maybe I read the description wrong, but I expected the arms and legs to be removable so my son could take them off, screw them on in a different spot, etc. In reality, the screws only come out - nothing actually is movable. He was excited about it when he got it, but was uninterested after about 30 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: BCooper

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little robot
customer_reviews.text: Bought fur my 2yr old and it was an awesome gift. Very sturdy and easy to use. He loves it and puts screws in and out constantly. Even the 8 year old liked playing with it. Would buy again as a birthday party gift for friends.
customer_reviews.author: Kristine Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for STEM inclined toddlers!
customer_reviews.text: I gifted this to my three year old nephew who loves to put things together, take them apart, and put them together again. He immediately caught on to the use of the tool to screw the parts together and got to work. He loved it! Since purchasing this one I’ve given two more as gifts.
customer_reviews.author: KMMB

customer_reviews.title: Cute little critical thinking toy!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great toy for critical thinking. The pieces are thick and not too small. The screwdriver is also very sturdy. It is easy to take apart and put together. The whole toy overall is pretty tough when being thrown all over the place. It's also nice for teaching colors because the screws are multi colored. You can also take the arms off and then screw them back in. Great little gift.
customer_reviews.author: Roberta Mann

customer_reviews.title: My son enjoys this, great for hand/ eye coordination
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old son seems to be enjoying this little robot. It’s a simple toy, but it is very good for developing hand and eye coordination. They also get to decorate it with stickers.
customer_reviews.author: Lynzee Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Educational insights ?
customer_reviews.text: My 4yr old did not find this Robot challeging. Once the screws went in with different colored screws, there is nothing else you can do. Would like to know what was the educational insights ? Is it the colored screws or the stickers ?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun, Bigger Than Expected
customer_reviews.text: This toy is so fun and has become a favorite for my grandson. Colors are vibrant, robot is larger than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Kim L.

customer_reviews.title: Kind of boring.
customer_reviews.text: All of the parts are the same. Other than different colored 'screws' the toy just didn't enthuse our normally interested child.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Well made and kids love it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 4 year old grandson who can’t wait to grow up so he can be on a robotics team. He likes it and so does his 2 year old brother. I bought 2 more for my occupational therapy students. It really holds their attention and addresses a number of skills.
customer_reviews.author: R.H.

customer_reviews.title: Cute but better for 4+
customer_reviews.text: We expected this to excite our robot crazed toddler and it did at first, but in the end, he really didn't care about the bolts and moving parts. He just wanted a robot toy and was frustrated by parts falling off. This might be better for a 4 year old.
customer_reviews.author: sheri Amsel

customer_reviews.title: Don't use the decorative stickers
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun little toy. However, the decorative stickers did not match up (they were different than packaged and didn't match the instructions). They were larger than the body of the robot and have since peeled off leaving a sticky mess to clean off. Otherwise, the toy is still functional and my toddler loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: This is not made of cheap plastic. It's durable especially for a 1 and 3 year old.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew K.

customer_reviews.title: Cute, but stickers unusable
customer_reviews.text: Really cute little guy for robot lovers and aspiring engineers. Would be 5 stars but the stickers they sent were printed upside down so they are unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Initial Look
customer_reviews.text: Writing a short review until Christmas when my son opens it! It came a day earlier than expected. It was packaged nicely with no damages. It looks bright and vibrant and I am so ready to see my son play with it. Will update then!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley M.

customer_reviews.title: Keeps them entertained forever
customer_reviews.text: My son is 2 1/2. He’s BUSY and he’s obsessed with this robot. Screwing and unscrewing the screws and arms is so exciting to him. Totally worth the $$
customer_reviews.author: Keri Hankerd

customer_reviews.title: Good toy for kids!
customer_reviews.text: My grandson loved this toy and he has a roomful of other toys. He spent hours assembling and taking apart the various pieces. Speaking as a grandparent, I think this is a good gift for children.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent toy
customer_reviews.text: My kids like this toy but -The stickers didn’t align well as others have said - the only parts you’re actually screwing together are the arms not even the legs or head A good start for a good price I suppose it just could’ve been better
customer_reviews.author: Surray

customer_reviews.title: OKAY
customer_reviews.text: Only the arms come off, so the set is just designed to screw in and unscrew, not create anything new. I would NOT consider this a STEM toy; it may help fine motor development.
customer_reviews.author: Gaye

customer_reviews.title: Colorful & Durable
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my four year old!! He loved this robot!!
customer_reviews.author: missus boone

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Cute but my 2 & 3 year old have no interest
customer_reviews.author: Boy Momma

customer_reviews.title: for very young children
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grandson whom is 4. It looks like a baby toy. I did not like it at all. I returned it. 4 year old children are smart. This would have been better for a 2-3 year old. Also it looks very CHEAP!
customer_reviews.author: DL T.

customer_reviews.title: Too many pieces and stickers!?
customer_reviews.text: Seriously there are too many pieces to this thing and you have to apply stickers to it once it is received. There are no clear instructions on where the stickers are even supposed to be applied. Don’t love it.
customer_reviews.author: Gigi

customer_reviews.title: Unusual Toy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because its not like anything you would pick up at Walmart. Fun toy for my son who is 2 1/2 - he loves to work on stuff and take things a part so this is right up his alley. Well made and the packaging was nice as well.
customer_reviews.author: Sarareada

customer_reviews.title: What I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Five year granddaughter has a parent who's an educator. That's why the purchase. You can tell mom spends a fair amount of time with this little girl, smart as a whip!!
customer_reviews.author: Molly Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Toddler Robot Designed for the task
customer_reviews.text: Maddox is not quite two, but he is very intelligent and gets bored easily. So I purchased this thinking it would be just the thing to keep him busy and was I ever right!!! YES, and thank you!! He loves it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Karen H.

customer_reviews.title: MY PRESCHOOLER'S LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little guy! Bought it for this week's STEAM theme along with the board-book version of "Robots, Robots Everywhere!", and it's made our science corner look so attractive. For the price, I would buy it over and over again!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gift!
customer_reviews.text: This toy is so fun. It's exactly as advertised. I love that it doesn't have batteries. You can take it anywhere without worrying about it breaking. Fix it, customize it with stickers. It's just a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a great toy for the price.
customer_reviews.text: My grandchild loves this toy. He loves to take it apart and put it back together. If you’re looking for something to keep your child occupied and they have an inquisitive mind, this is the toy for them.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn B.

customer_reviews.title: My four year old wanted a robot.
customer_reviews.text: She got this for her birthday and she likes to pretend she's a robot doctor.
customer_reviews.author: Bree

customer_reviews.title: Great stem toy
customer_reviews.text: Great gift for a 3-5 year old. My 3 year old daughter has it and loves it so we bought it for a friend that also loves it
customer_reviews.author: jamie

customer_reviews.title: Cute and fun toy
customer_reviews.text: It was a gift for our 2 year old that we got for him and he loves it. So do the 10 & 7.5 year olds. It’s cute and I’m sure will be all over my house for years to come!
customer_reviews.author: JS+PGO

customer_reviews.title: Colorful and easy to use for toddler
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old loves this robot. He puts it to bed with him every night. It’s so bright and colorful. And easy to take apart. And put together.
customer_reviews.author: Pricilla

customer_reviews.title: Great for little builders!
customer_reviews.text: My three year old grandson loves to take it apart and put it back together time after time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: My son loved this! Very helpful for motor skills as well!
customer_reviews.author: Marcie

customer_reviews.title: Fun beginner STEM gift
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my son’s best friend’s birthday, and he loved it! The screws are compatible with the toy Craftsmen power drill as well! Also, it can take a toss to the hard floor without breaking, so that’s a plus!
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for toddler coordination
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my toddler because he was suddenly obsessed with robots. It made a cute gift and helps with coordination skills. He loves taking it apart and putting it back together
customer_reviews.author: Amber B.

customer_reviews.title: Great for hands on kids
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my little buddy Brody. He's 3 and his dad's a mechanic. He loved tearing this thing apart.
customer_reviews.author: Anastasia Poulos

customer_reviews.title: SUPER CUTE!!
customer_reviews.text: Given as a gift to a 6 year old. He might be at the tail end of the ages this is for. I thought it would be different somehow. Im not sure what i expected because its exactly as pictured. Its adorable. Its chunky and easy to hold on to.
customer_reviews.author: Mandi McGee

customer_reviews.title: Perfect toy!
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this toy. He carries it everywhere. You have to put it together, but even that was fun for my son because it’s really easy to screw in the arms and legs. He takes it apart sometimes just to use his “tools” and put it back together. Would recommend, especially since it is a big, durable toy for a good price.
customer_reviews.author: chelsey sample

customer_reviews.title: Cute
customer_reviews.text: Very cute. Smaller than expected, but still very nice. 2 1/2 yr grandson loves it
customer_reviews.author: Seashell OsTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great toy
customer_reviews.text: Five year old son loved it for a week now it's lost but what's new lol
customer_reviews.author: Brandon P

customer_reviews.title: 3 year old loves, arms keep falling off
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 3 year old. He loves it. My only issue with it is i wish the arm bolts had a washer or something so the arms stop falling off. Besides that its a kid toy. What do you expect?
customer_reviews.author: Shrek.Ona

customer_reviews.title: Educational Gift
customer_reviews.text: My grandson who is 4..loved this as one of his Christmas presents!
customer_reviews.author: Tanja Myszak-Dreamscape Salon

customer_reviews.title: Great for your little creative child
customer_reviews.text: Just like description. My4 year old nephew loves this toy because it is. a robot and he can fix it but is very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Shar

customer_reviews.title: Really cool robot
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my robot obsessed 5 year old for Christmas and he loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Doing the robot...
customer_reviews.text: This was a birthday present for my 5 year old son. He loves robots and he loves taking things apart so this was a win-win. It's adorable and comes with stickers which are fun for decorating.
customer_reviews.author: GypsyRose_03

customer_reviews.title: Basic but fun
customer_reviews.text: Excellent stem toy for 22 months old. My son has mastered screwing and unscrewing the bolts with no problem. I love seeing his face light up each time he does one
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: My nephew's favorite gift
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 4 year old nephew for Christmas. He loves robots and this is still his favorite gift. He lost the screwdriver. I hope they sell replacements.
customer_reviews.author: Book Lover

customer_reviews.title: Fun robot toy for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent toy for developing gross motor skills. My daughter loves it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: If he loves robots!
customer_reviews.text: Great for that little robot lover who loves nuts and bolts.
customer_reviews.author: Teri

customer_reviews.title: Broke before it was ever used...
customer_reviews.text: Fun idea. Poor quality. Broke when assembled by a toddler..
customer_reviews.author: Amzn Cstmr

customer_reviews.title: Cute and fun motor skills toy
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 3 year olds birthday. He absolutely loves it and still, 7 months later, he puts it together and tears it apart several times a day.
customer_reviews.author: Britney McVicker

customer_reviews.title: Grandson Loves it
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our 5 1/2 year old grandson and he told his dad he loved this robot. It was so cool.
customer_reviews.author: V. Hobbs

customer_reviews.title: Ehh
customer_reviews.text: Though you would also be able to assemble a little.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cute toy
customer_reviews.text: Cute! My son loved it. It doesn’t make any noise or anything but it’s cute.
customer_reviews.author: CandaceK

customer_reviews.title: fun toy
customer_reviews.text: he kids love to build and rebuild this- great in the classroom
customer_reviews.author: Nancy kindergarten teacher

customer_reviews.title: Cutest robot!
customer_reviews.text: My 5 year old son is obsessed with Robots and he wanted one for Christmas. I found this one and he LOVES it! His favorite present. Super cute! And great price. And It won’t break into pieces which is the best part
customer_reviews.author: Sophia

customer_reviews.title: Great Robot Toy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my three year old son and he loves it! The screw driver is the perfect size. The only issue is that the screws are a little hard for him to get started. I screw it in a little for him and then he finishes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids learning hand skills
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this. He takes it apart and puts is back together over and over again for hours.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Krautwurst

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing for 3 year old
customer_reviews.text: Toddler wanted robot for Xmas. Got this and he couldn’t care less about screwing in bolts. Nothing else to do with it besides place on a few stickers. Disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Hello!

customer_reviews.title: He enjoyed it.
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a Christmas gift for my 1yr old nephew.
customer_reviews.author: KittyCarrieAll

customer_reviews.title: Cute toy but my 3 and a half year old ...
customer_reviews.text: Cute toy but my 3 and a half year old doesn't play with it much. Even when she does play with it, it only holds her attention for 5 minutes max.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Chavez

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful toy
customer_reviews.text: We gave it to our 3 year old grandson for Christmas. He absolutely loves it and is so proud when he can put it together and take it apart by himself.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia M. Calder

customer_reviews.title: Kids loved it!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for fun, while developing hand eye, concentration, motor skills and engineering.
customer_reviews.author: Gorgeguy

customer_reviews.title: Great for little hands
customer_reviews.text: My grandson and granddaughter just love this robot,easy to play with
customer_reviews.author: elisabete roubal

customer_reviews.title: Recommend for little boys
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this toy! It’s a great activity; sturdy parts.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Adorable, Fun, Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: This little robot was a Christmas gift for my almost 3 year old. He absolutely loves it and has been playing with it almost non stop for 2 days. It's cute, durable, and highly interactive.
customer_reviews.author: Nik

customer_reviews.title: Fun learning tool
customer_reviews.text: This is a great gift. Great learning tool and fine motor skills. Building something and growing/ learning new abilities.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Faircloth

customer_reviews.title: 2y old loves this!
customer_reviews.text: My 2y old loves this robot! He has managed to pull the screwdriver apart, but it still works :)
customer_reviews.author: Jenn Watson

customer_reviews.title: Have fun screwing (bolts)
customer_reviews.text: Great $10 toddler toy. My 18 month old is fascinated with trying to fasten and unfasten the bolts, and the robot persona gives it another dynamic that will probably keep it an active toy longer than a workbench toy with bolts.
customer_reviews.author: N. McManus

customer_reviews.title: Excellent STEM toy
customer_reviews.text: Gifted to a 4-yr old and he loves it .. so did his parents!!
customer_reviews.author: GeeGee

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: It has a lot of pieces which is great. My kids really like it and play with it often. My 2 year old loves robots this has been such a hit in our home.
customer_reviews.author: K.O.

customer_reviews.title: My grandson does not play with this
customer_reviews.text: My 2 yr old grandson does not play with this
customer_reviews.author: Amy Jo Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Not very high for creativity
customer_reviews.text: Good quality toy, but kid may not like to play after 10mins, not much creativity involved after screw are tightened and removed.
customer_reviews.author: AK

customer_reviews.title: Nice Robot
customer_reviews.text: My 4 and 2 year old really liked them. Pieces will get lost. Not overly complicated. No sounds and doesn’t light up a plus!!
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: not at all what i expected. got it for ...
customer_reviews.text: not at all what i expected. got it for my 4 year old son and he only held interest in it for a couple hours.
customer_reviews.author: k

customer_reviews.title: Fun skillbuilding robot
customer_reviews.text: My four year old LOVES it. Great for the price. It's a good skill to work on as well.
customer_reviews.author: tyse

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 3 year old for Christmas. He loves it so much. The screwdriver is easy for him to hold and he enjoys putting the screws in and taking them out.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun activity
customer_reviews.text: Fun toy for my 3 year old. He loved to take it apart and put it together. First think he did was name it Della. Super cute robot
customer_reviews.author: CJ FL

customer_reviews.title: Very cute for toddlers/preschoolers
customer_reviews.text: This is really cute for little kids. My 4yo girl loves this and pretend plays all the time. She loves taking off the arms and putting them back.
customer_reviews.author: Ash

customer_reviews.title: More details in description of toy
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting to be able to put different pieces and stickers on. However didn't come with all the stickers it says and the parts are only play screws. It read in description as if it was something more
customer_reviews.author: Baby girl

product_meta.title: Educational Insights Design & Drill Robot: Kid-Powered Introduction to STEM for Preschoolers, Great Gifts for Boys & Girls 3+
product_meta.description: Get ready for kid-powered robot fun! Little engineers will love the all-new Design & Drill Robot-the perfect introduction to STEM learning. Preschoolers can snap together their robot’s arms and then practice drilling multicolored bolts with the kid-friendly screwdriver to secure their masterpiece. Kids can customize their rockin’ robot with colorful, decorative stickers, and then it’s ready for play!
feature_bullets: Preschoolers can snap together their robot’s arms and then practice drilling multicolored bolts with the kid-friendly screwdriver
Robot with swiveling head, arms, and upper body, includes 15 multicolored bolts
Easy-to-use, kid-friendly screwdriver, and decorative stickers
Builds construction and fine motor skills
Supports STEM learning: introduces tools that promote interest in engineering

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
